title: Downton Abbey movie 'set for sequel' after smashing 'over £100million'

Downton Abbey has proved to have been as popular on the big screen as it has on TV, leading to calls for a sequel.

The Julian Fellowes penned movie has already reportedly topped £100 million at the box office in less than a month since it opened and the desire for another helping has increased.

A source told The Sun: “Downton’s popularity as a film has been phenomenal.

“It took £60million in America alone and has been a roaring success. Julian and the team are over the moon with how it played out.

"No one expected it would be this big."

(Image: Getty Images)

With a renewed appetite for all things Downton, writer Julian Fellowes is reportedly coming up with ideas as to how a sequel would pan out.

In good news for Downton fans, writer Julian Fellowes has reportedly been asked to start coming up with ideas for another spin-off.

Their source explained: “The commercial viability of a second film is now a dead cert, so Julian has been told to start putting pen to paper on the follow-up.”

(Image: Digital / 35mm)

(Image: Digital / 35mm)

The series finished on ITV in 2015 and the movie was long rumoured before finally being put into production.

It followed the drama in the manor house as King George V and Queen Mary came to visit and it starred Downton stalwarts Dame Maggie Smith, Jim Carter and Michelle Dockery.

(Image: Digital / 35mm)

Speaking to The Sun, co-producer Gareth Neame pointed out that it is not often easy taking a popular TV show to the cinema.

He said: “Doing spin-offs from TV series are very tricky. It’s not the normal course of business.”
